subtitle: Always a teatime favourite, this classic recipe uses honey to replace the traditional golden syrup.

method.text: Preheat oven to 180°C. Lightly grease and line an 18 cm square cake tin.
Place the honey and butter in a pan. Heat gently for 1-2 min, until melted. Remove from the heat. Stir in the remaining ingredients until well mixed. Spoon into the cake tin.
Smooth over the surface. Place in the oven for 30-35 min, until golden brown.
Leave to cool in the tin slightly. Cut into equal fingers. Leave to cool completely on a wire rack, for approximately 30 min.

title: Honeyed flapjacks
